I’m Student_E and I am submitting my formal [APPLY] for the final round/market-close reassessment.

School_E remains my clear first-choice school. If you are able to extend an offer for the remaining seat at market close (or at any final reassessment point), I will accept immediately and commit to enrolling.

Thank you for keeping my standing interest on file and for considering my application in your final priority-based decision.

Sincerely,
Student_E
conversation.thought: It is the final round (30) and the only unmatched school is School_E, which is my top true preference. School_E previously advised that submitting a formal [APPLY] in the final round is the best way to ensure I’m considered at market close/final reassessment. I will therefore submit a clear, formal application reiterating my immediate commitment to enroll if offered, and explicitly reference that this is my final-round submission for their market-close reassessment.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for submitting your formal application for the final round and for your sustained interest in School_E.

As we are now at the market-close/final reassessment point and our seat remains available, we are able to extend you an offer of admission. We acknowledge and appreciate your clear commitment to enroll immediately if accepted.

Congratulations—we are pleased to offer you admission to School_E.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Round 30 is the final round/market close. My quota is 1 and the only applicant in my inbox is Student_E. Under my true priority list, Student_E is eligible (ranked 5th). Although I prefer higher-ranked students, none have applied to School_E throughout the process, and there is no further opportunity to wait after market close. Accepting Student_E is better than leaving the seat unfilled given the objective to fill within quota with the best available applicant at close.
